Author: tholin
Content:
For some reason, I can‚Äôt  run cocotb anymore? Even in projects where it used to work, on two different systems and inside the iic-osic-tools container. Its all broken.
It instantly quits with the message `/bin/sh: line 1: /cmds.f: Permission denied` when trying to build target `/sim.vpp`

Author: tholin
Content: Yeah, apparently there was an update and I had to edit all my makefiles.

Author: tholin
Content: I get console spam before my tests run, though

Author: mole99
Content:
@Tholin You can use the Nix setup in the template which comes with cocotb 2.0.

Yes, that is to be expected given that iverilog does not support that feature. This is only important, however, if you run SDF-backannotated simulations.

Author: tholin
Content: So, about the fab SRAM macros: they have their VDD/VSS power straps on the Metal3 layer in the form of horizontal strips. However, the vertical Metal4 strips in chip_top‚Äôs power grid will not connect to them. Why?

Author: tholin
Content: Also, the SRAM macros have DRC errors.

Author: 246tnt
Content: Are you sure they do ?  AFAIR Magic thinks they do because the tech file doesn't know about sram rules. But if you checks they are all false positive

Author: rebelmike
Content: I believe the SRAM macro in https://github.com/MichaelBell/ttgf0p2-tinyQV/actions/runs/18697252507 is connected correctly, though would appreciate a double check on that!

Author: rebelmike
Content: However, that project is a bit stalled, both because of the DRC errors (which should be ignorable), and because when I increased the utilisation I started getting LVS errors.

Author: 246tnt
Content: It's connected through power but only on the end. The only reason I can think of for that is that the LEF only defines the end zone as pins for connections.

Author: 246tnt
Content: It's also connected in the center control zone. So maybe they wanted to avoid random vias in the SRAM core zone, maybe it can distord metal a bit or cause some stress that they didn't want to risk given the tighter rules they use in there.

Author: rebelmike
Content: Yeah, I had to be fairly precise aligning the met4 stripes to get the connections to align with the pins.

Author: tholin
Content: Any reason why only those end zones are valid pins? Could the LEF be updated to label the whole horizontal strips?

Author: 246tnt
Content: As stated above, the only reason I can think of is avoid any disturbance in the sram core area ...
